name: oj-row-expander
description: Enable hierarchical data to be displayed in a JET Table and JET DataGrid.

context.description: The context object obtained from the column renderer (Table) or cell renderer (DataGrid)

expanded.description: Specifies if the RowExpander is expanded.

translations.description:
A collection of translated resources from the translation bundle, or null if this
component has no resources. Resources may be accessed and overridden individually or collectively, as seen in the examples. If the component does not contain any translatable resource, the default value of this attribute will be 
null. If not, an object containing all resources relevant to the component.

If this component has translations, their documentation immediately follows this doc entry.

accessibleLevelDescription.description:
Provides properties to customize the accessible context level of the expanded or collapsed row

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

accessibleRowCollapsed.description:
Provides properties to customize the accessible context when a row is collapsed

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

accessibleRowDescription.description:
Provides properties to customize the accessible context level and index of the row

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

accessibleRowExpanded.description:
Provides properties to customize the accessible context when a row is expanded

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

accessibleStateCollapsed.description:
Provides properties to customize the accessible state of a collapsed row

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

accessibleStateExpanded.description:
Provides properties to customize the accessible state of an expanded row

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

setProperty.description:
Sets a property or a single subproperty for complex properties and notifies the component
of the change, triggering a [property]Changed event.

params.name: property
params.description: The property name to set. Supports dot notation for subproperty access.

params.name: value
params.description: The new value to set the property to.

getProperty.description: Retrieves a value for a property or a single subproperty for complex properties.

params.name: property
params.description: The property name to get. Supports dot notation for subproperty access.

setProperties.description: Performs a batch set of properties.

params.name: properties
params.description: An object containing the property and value pairs to set.

ojExpand.description: Triggered when a expand is performed on the RowExpander

rowKey.description: the key of the expanded row

ojCollapse.description: Triggered when a collapse is performed on the RowExpander

rowKey.description: the key of the collapsed row

contextMenu.description:
The contextMenu slot is set on the oj-menu within this element. 
This is used to designate the JET Menu that this component should launch as a context menu on right-click, Shift-F10, Press & Hold, or component-specific gesture. 
If specified, the browser's native context menu will be replaced by the JET Menu specified in this slot.

The application can register a listener for the Menu's ojBeforeOpen event. The listener can cancel the launch via event.preventDefault(), 
or it can customize the menu contents by editing the menu DOM directly, and then calling refresh() on the Menu.

To help determine whether it's appropriate to cancel the launch or customize the menu, the ojBeforeOpen listener can use component API's to determine which 
table cell, chart item, etc., is the target of the context menu. See the JSDoc and demos of the individual components for details. 

Keep in mind that any such logic must work whether the context menu was launched via right-click, Shift-F10, Press & Hold, or component-specific touch gesture.
